title: Citizenship in the Community
summary: Learn how local government works, how public meetings run, how issues surface, and where you can pitch in to improve your community.

resources.title: National League of Cities – Civic Education
resources.description: Background on how local governments operate and engage residents.

resources.title: ICMA Student Resources
resources.description: Explains the roles of city and county managers with case studies.

resources.title: USA.gov – Local Governments
resources.description: Directory and overview of counties, municipalities, and special districts.

modules.title: Citizenship: The Value of Belonging
modules.prompt: In 2–3 paragraphs, explain what 'citizenship' means in your daily life and list two obligations and two rights you have in your community.

modules.title: How Local Governments Are Structured
modules.instructions: Summarize how counties, municipalities, school districts, and special districts divide responsibilities where you live. Add one example for each.

modules.title: Observe a Public Meeting
modules.instructions: Attend (or watch a recording of) a city/town/school board meeting. Record agenda items, one debated issue, and how representatives voted. Submit a 1-page objective report.

modules.title: Identify a Local Issue
modules.instructions: Pick a real local issue (e.g., traffic, park access, zoning). Interview or email one local official or informed adult. Summarize the issue, stakeholders, and one way youth can help.

modules.title: Make a Difference
modules.instructions: Plan and complete a community contribution (e.g., clean-up, info flyer, small advocacy step). Log what you did, hours, who benefited, and outcomes.
